content: On a visit to Mexico and New Zealand, you'll need to change dollars into what?

In Mexico, the local currency is the Mexican Peso (MXN), and in New Zealand, it's the New Zealand Dollar (NZD). So, when you're visiting these countries, you'll need to exchange your US Dollars (USD) into their respective local currencies.

For Mexico, you'll be changing USD to MXN, and for New Zealand, you'll be changing USD to NZD. It's always a good idea to get familiar with the current exchange rates before you go, so you know how much you're getting for your money. Also, consider the fees associated with currency exchanges, as some methods might charge higher fees than others.

Enjoy your travels! If you have any more questions, feel free to ask.
